wikipedia_page.main: Roy Hession (1908–1992) was a British evangelist and author.

response: Hession was born in Golders Green, England in 1909 to Colin and Ida Hession.  His brother was Roy Hession, a well-known evangelical preacher who in 1950 authored the religious book The Calvary Road.  Brian's father served in the armed forces during World War I, and after returning home in 1919, was diagnosed with general paralysis of the insane, which is now commonly referred to as neurosyphilis.  Colin passed away in 1921 of the ailment at Napsbury Hospital, which was used as a military and mental health asylum at the time.
